definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Stop cry, or you'll raise the roof.
sentences.chinese: 别吵了，否则房顶都被你掀掉了。

sentences.english: Our roof was torn off in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨中我们的屋顶被掀掉。

sentences.english: The storm just whipped the roof off during the night!
sentences.chinese: 昨晚的暴风雨一下子把房顶掀掉了。

sentences.english: The storm whipped the roof off last night.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨昨晚把房顶掀掉了。

sentences.english: He lifted, and pushed the table away in anger.
sentences.chinese: 他怒不可遏地掀掉了桌子。

sentences.english: The heavy wind blew roofs off in several cities.
sentences.chinese: 在好几个城市大风掀掉了屋顶。

sentences.english: Last night's storm nearly took the roof off!
sentences.chinese: 昨夜的暴风雨几乎将房顶都掀掉了。

sentences.english: Last night the wind blew terribly hard and had the roof off.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚风刮得大极了，把屋顶都掀掉了。

sentences.english: In the lightning I saw that the roof of the hut had been blown off.
sentences.chinese: 闪电的时候，我看见棚屋的屋顶被掀掉了。

definition: to pry open or apart/to spread (sth) open with both hands
to push aside (clothing, curtain etc) to reveal something/to toss aside
to tear up/to tear to pieces
with a crash/with a thunderous noise
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
half of sth/one side of sth
